export_format.description: Platform 4.0 exports XML using QRDA Cat I format. Platform 3.5 exports XML-based CCD (C-CDA) files for individual or groups of patients. No details on packaging or container format. Both reference HL7 standards compliance.

documentation.notes: The EHI export documentation is a few paragraphs of inline prose on the certified products page. No data dictionary, schema, field definitions, or downloadable specification exists. The 2.2 MB of downloads are compliance certificates and mandatory disclosure letters, not export documentation.

clinical.evidence: CCD/C-CDA format inherently includes clinical data (problems, medications, allergies, procedures, results, immunizations, vital signs). QRDA Cat I includes quality measure data.

secure_messages.evidence: No mention of messages, inbox, communication, portal messaging, or correspondence in the export documentation or mandatory disclosure letters.

billing_financial.evidence: No mention of billing, charges, claims, payments, CPT codes, or financial data in the export documentation. CCD/C-CDA format does not natively include billing data.

insurance_coverage.evidence: No mention of insurance, coverage, eligibility, payer, or plan information in the export documentation. CCD/C-CDA format has limited insurance representation.

appointments_scheduling.evidence: No mention of appointments, scheduling, encounters, or visits in the export documentation.

documents_images.evidence: No mention of documents, images, attachments, scans, or multimedia in the export documentation.

audit_trails.evidence: No mention of audit logs, access tracking, or history in the export documentation. Platform 3.5 is certified for (d)(2) Auditable Events and (d)(3) Audit Reports but these are not mentioned in the EHI export section.

issues: No data dictionary or schema: The EHI export documentation is a few sentences of prose with no field-level detail whatsoever.
Inconsistent export format claims: Platform 4.0 says QRDA Cat I (a quality reporting format), Platform 3.5 says CCD (a clinical summary format). Neither is a comprehensive EHI export format.

QRDA Cat I is not an EHI format: QRDA Cat I exports clinical quality measure data, not 'all electronic health information.' This appears to conflate the (c)(1-3) CQM criteria with the (b)(10) EHI export criterion.
CCD/C-CDA is limited: While more comprehensive than QRDA, C-CDA CCD does not include billing, insurance, scheduling, messages, audit trails, or custom/specialty data.
No mention of how non-clinical data is exported or whether it is included at all.
No sample exports, developer guides, or processing tools provided.
Documentation appears to be compliance boilerplate rather than genuine technical documentation.
summary: Persivia's EHI export documentation consists of a few paragraphs of inline text on their certified products page. Platform 4.0 claims to export in QRDA Cat I XML format (a quality measure reporting format, not a comprehensive EHI format). Platform 3.5 claims to export CCD (C-CDA XML) files for single or multiple patients. There is no data dictionary, field-level documentation, schema, or downloadable specification. The documentation provides no evidence that the export covers 'all EHI' as required by 170.315(b)(10) â€” both formats described are standardized clinical document formats that exclude billing, insurance, messaging, scheduling, audit, and other non-clinical data.
